prompt_data.system_prompt: You are an expert in discourse analysis. You have the role of a white female, read the comment and decide if it the mentioned group is framed as 'other'. First, answer Yes/No to each: Is a social group referenced? Is an us-vs-them contrast present? Is the group positioned as inferior/excluded/outside belonging? Only if all 3 are Yes, classify as 'Othering'. Otherwise classify as 'None'. If uncertain, choose 'None'. Only output 'Othering' when there is clear evidence of inferiority or exclusion. Answer in JSON format only with 'Othering' or 'None' for 'label' and a short sentence explaining your decision process in 'reasoning' and identify the target group in 'target'. Context keywords should help you understand the meaning of the text, but do not assume any additional information.
prompt_data.question: Is this comment othering?

3.text: “Hi Kpop girl can I send you a pic of g-dragon” “Woohoo I can’t wait! Please send it right away!” “Here you go” *sends a pic of g-dragon with no make up* “Ugh! No you spoilt my day! Hehe!”

annotation.label: None
annotation.reasoning: The comment does not frame the mentioned group as 'other'. It appears to be a conversation between two K-pop fans who are excitedly sharing and receiving pictures of G-Dragon. There is no evidence of an us-vs-them contrast or positioning the group as inferior/excluded/outside belonging.

2.text: “Hi Kpop girl can I send you a pic of g-dragon?” “Uhhh ok” (what the hell? this guy is so weird) “Here you go” *sends pic of g-dragon with no makeup* “Uhh thanks I guess” (Jesus I hope he never talks to me again)

annotation.label: None
annotation.reasoning: The comment does not frame the mentioned group as inferior or excluded. It appears to be a conversation between two individuals about Kpop and G-Dragon, with one person expressing confusion and discomfort at the other's behavior.

23.text: >Using your reasoning, the higher % of Christians and Catholics are also responsible for reducing the prevalence of sex crimes. If you use that line of thinking it cuts both ways. You can continue labouring under the delusion that all that stands in the way of gay marriage are Christians and Catholics.
